title.narrative: Nutrition Education promotion of gender equality and empowerment of poor girls and women in Cameroon

description.narrative: The project is continuation of a project between the Cameroonian Association of Home Economics Counsellors ACESF-CA and the Finnish Martha Association. The Family Federation of Finland will join to strengthen comprehensive sexuality education (CSE) among y oung girls and poor women. In Cameroon 37.5% of the population of 8.1 million people live below the poverty threshold set at 931 CFAF (141 ?) per day for adult. Women are the most affected by this poverty and living conditions of their families. On the oth er hand the current life and future of the young girls are influenced by sexist discriminations which result from poor sociocultural practices. Often underprivileged women have very thin knowledge on nutrition the nutritive value of local foods and sexual health. The overall objective of the project is to contribute to an increased empowerment of poor women and girls in families and the Cameroonian society.The project is composed of four strategic axes: 1. Nutrition education of poor women2. Improve the inc ome of beneficiaries (women with low income)3. Promote gender equality and the empowerment of girls of the Home Economics field through CSE and entrepreneurship training4. Create a resource and business centre for ACESF-CA to serve better its beneficiaries The direct beneficiaries are: 720 poor women who will take part in the training sessions on nutrition; 210 underprivileged women who will be accompanied in the drafting and execution of their business plans; 900 girls of the Home Economics field grouped un der 12 ACESF-CA/SU clubs who learn reading CSE and entrepreneurship; 12 regional animators and 60 volunteer members chosen from Home Economics professionals who are members of ACESF-CA who will take refresher courses in pedagogy on CSE nutrition and entrep reneurship.The intervention zone of the project will comprise six regions: Bafoussam Bamenda Bertoua Douala Maroua and Yaounde. The project partners are Martat ACESF-CA and Family Federation of Finland in collaboration with CAMNAFAW and the external servic es of the Ministry of Women Empowerment and the Family (MINPROFF) and the Ministry of Secondary Education (MINESEC).
